Assume $0 < r < 3$.  Below are five equations for $x$.  Which equation has the largest solution $x$?

$\textbf{(A)}\ 3(1 + r)^x = 7\qquad \textbf{(B)}\ 3(1 + r/10)^x = 7\qquad \textbf{(C)}\ 3(1 + 2r)^x = 7$ $\textbf{(D)}\ 3(1 + \sqrt {r})^x = 7\qquad \textbf{(E)}\ 3(1 + 1/r)^x = 7$

1.subquestion: Simplify Equation A as much as possible using properties of exponents.

subanswer.text: Taking logarithm base $(\text{ }(1+r))$ at both sides and solving for $x$: \[\log_b (1+r)(x)= \log_b (\frac{7}{3})\]\[\therefore x =\log_{\frac{7}{3}} ((1+r))= \frac{\log_{e}(1+r)}{\log_{e}(\frac{7}{3})}\] So simplifying Expression C similarly yields:\[x=\frac{\log(\frac{8}{7})}{\log(\frac{1+2r}{3})} \]Since here $r<3,$ hence range includes values greater than or equal to zero but lesser than three i.e., $[0,3].$ As $$\lim_{y\to+\infty}\frac{\ln (8)-\ln(7)}{-\ln(3)+\ln(1+2y)}=-1$$So expression E's limit tends towards negative infinity indicating no solutions exist within range; therefore eliminates Option B & D since they don't have any real roots within mentioned domain whereas Options C & A could possibly yield such positive root which would tend toward maximum among them based upon their coefficients under exponent term($1+r&1+2r$) . Hence Eliminating option 'C'. Thus leaving only choices either ('A')or('B'). Comparatively evaluating options:'A': Increasing nature follows Law Of Exponential Growth while decreasing Nature follows Rule Composed By Power Series Sum Expansion Formula Yield Results Approaching Limit At Large Values Range Whereas Conversely Reverse Relationship Applicable Over Same Domain With Choice ‘’‘B” , But Again Consider Only Rows Within Defined Interval [0,3]; Here Resultant Value Becomes Zero Or Negative Number Due To Log Function Denominator Component Containing Addition Between Constants One And Variable MultipliedBy Three ; Therefore Cannot Acquire Valid Real Solution Based Upon Our Definition Previously Stated Earlier On Pertinent Context Question Regarding Problem Setup Outlined Therein Having Analyzed Each Provided Condition Throughout Entirety Under Discussion Process Further Narrow Down Potential Possibilities Using Arithmetical Calculations Via Properties Specific To Algebraic Expressions Mathematically Utilizing Principles Governance Associated Effective Means Allow Computational Workflow Focused Directly Towards Target Output Determ
